title: (18360) Huétor Tájar - 1 Calle Patio de los Leones
title_short: (18360) Huétor Tájar - 1 Calle Patio de los Leones
description: Free parking day and night next to the Genil river where you can find restaurants, shops, parks. Quiet area to visit the town and many activities that take place throughout the year.

title: (18360) Huétor Tájar - 59 Calle Jaen
description: Self-service laundry. Easy parking. Bars nearby.

title: (18360) Venta Nueva - GR-4400
description: Gas station you can change black and gray water and remember clean water, in exchange you fill diesel

title: (18360) Huétor Tájar - 5 Calle Zona de Valor 13
title_short: (18360) Huétor Tájar - 5 Calle Zona de Valor 13
description: Quiet free parking with many places. We stopped here on our way from Malaga to Granada. Between park and football field.

title: (18360) Huétor Tájar - Carretera Granada Sevilla
description: Rest area with sitting area, showers and gas. The restaurant that offers services is called Área Vega del Poniente. nice shower. Clean toilets. Friendly staff, despite my terrible Spanish. Open from 6am to midnight daily.

title: (18360) Huétor Tájar - 7 Calle Rosalía de Castro
title_short: (18360) Huétor Tájar - 7 Calle Rosalía de Castro
description: Water fountain on the street. Parking on the street.

title: (18360) Huétor Tájar - 35 Calle Velázquez
description: A parking lot near the city, where we slept and ate in the evening. Passing by but rather nice people. The children came to see the camper discreetly. Between a clay football pitch and the town bowling alley. Shops nearby

title: (18310) Salar - A-4155
description: Gas station on a country road with gray and black water drain and drinking water hose. Next to it is a camper pitch on flat, somewhat dusty ground. A sign explicitly allows camping for 24 hours. There is space for at least two WoMos. Picnic tables are also part of the complimentary service.

title: (18310) Salar - 211 Barrio Sau
description: Quiet place where you can sleep, fits a long motorhome.

title: (18369) Villanueva Mesía -
description:
Flat esplanade in the "Cerro Colorao" ideal for a van or a small AC.
Very close to the rural hostel Cortijo del Guarda.
Quiet place with little vehicle traffic. You can take a walk to the Genil River dam.
no service

title: (18370) Moraleda de Zafayona - 12 Extramuros Extrarradio
description: Very great place for parking, next to the highway and quiet

title: (18300) Loja - A-4154
description: Quite and distant place to go with a Van, nice surroundings, quite difficult approach

title: (18300) Loja - 1B Urbanización Suelo Urbano S-12
description: Drinking water in pressure tap, difficult to connect with a hose but good for filling a jerry can.

title: (18300) Loja - 77 Avenida Andalucía
description: Place with walkway to wash the motorhome

title: (18300) Loja - 15 Avenida de la Paz
description: Quiet place to spend the day, next to the Mercadona

title: (18300) Loja - 21 Avenida Alcaudique
description: Quiet field next to the cemetery

title: (18300) Loja - C. Carmen de los Angeles
title_short: (18300) Loja - C. Carmen de los Angeles
description:
Large flat field with a lot of space, it is 3 min walk from the center and with various services such as laundry at 100 MTR, several bakeries, pastry shops also at 100 MTR.
edit ....is now a tarmac car park
take first right out of carpark and along near the cafes ....other routes out roads are too small .check first because is a long way to reverse !

title: (18300) Loja - 24 Calle Rafael Pérez del Álamo
title_short: (18300) Loja - 24 Calle Rafael Pérez del Álamo
description: Parking next to the municipal pavilion of Loja. Right next to the pantry restaurant where asking for a drink you get very good tapas for free and right next to it is the bonachera bakery where you can buy bread and sweets typical of Loja such as their donuts or cinnamon buns.

title: (18300) Loja - 3 Camino Molinillos
description: Disposal inside the village of Loja, very quiet place to spend the night with many bars and shops nearby.

title: (18300) Loja - 44 Calle Rafael Pérez del Álamo
title_short: (18300) Loja - 44 Calle Rafael Pérez del Álamo
description: Parking at the fairgrounds, go towards the roundabout and turn right before the last house on the right, where it says C/Cádiz on the map. Very quiet place to spend the night.

title: (18300) Loja - 3 Calle Loja Ecuador
description: Very quiet and shady place next to the hospital

title: (18300) Loja - 3 Calle Fez
description: Municipal area of recent creation, so much so that it is not signposted yet. Free water filling and emptying services. Very spacious squares next to the municipal pavilion and the hospital, near the cinema and the center and restaurant areas.

title: (18300) Loja - 19 Avenida Fernando de los Rios
title_short: (18300) Loja - 19 Avenida Fernando de los Rios
description: Facing the football field at the end of the road. Nice we could let go of the dog. It was a Friday training until 9:30 pm without genes.

title: (18370) Loreto -
description: Kind of car park, near the bridge that spans the genil stream. Leaving the road on an easily accessible dirt road. Parking on a slope except on the bottom or near the stream. you will be in the shade there. To have lunch or spend the night there. Low traffic road. The place is isolated.

title: (18300) Loja -
description:
Even better then the one next to here. Less highway noise and zero traffic. It's next to an old rock quarry. The road there has some overhanging bushes, but nothing too scratchy.

If you're looking for shelter from wind or sun, you can even park in the quarry. The spaces are plenty and flat. Good views and trials all around. A few hikers. You can join them and make a short or long hike in the hills.

title: (18300) Loja - 1 Cuesta del Socorro
description: Picnic area on the side of the road with drinking water and 2 tables. No shade. There are only 2 parking plces for 2 small cars or 1 camper

title: (18300) Loja - Unnamed Road
description: Parking area with tables and barbecue. I guess if you stay overnight, no one will tell you anything.

title: (18300) Loja - Unnamed Road
description: Parking area along a motorable road with some potholes, which goes up to the heights. Rather flat land, superb view of Loja below, all surrounded by nature.

title: (18370) Granada - 89P Extramuros Extrarradio
description: Near the highway with restaurant and showers

title: (18300) Loja - 84 Arco de Plines
description: Drinking water

title: (18370) Loreto -
description: Parking area for a quick stop. Parking mostly exposed to the sun, but if your minivan is not too high behind the restaurant there are also car parks with awnings!

title: (18370) Moraleda de Zafayona - 212 Carretera Autovia A-92
title_short: (18370) Moraleda de Zafayona - 212 Carretera Autovia A-92
description: Gas station with water

title: (18300) Loja - A-92
description: Service station on the A92 Manzanil motorway in the service area towards Malaga. Burger King until 1:00 and area Open 24/24. Restaurant, cafe, hotel. Large parking lot for the night.

title: (18300) Loja - km 189 A-92
description: On the A92 motorway and strategically located, is the Abades Loja service area. Its location allows it to be very close to the cities of Malaga, Granada, Jaen and Cordoba. Thanks to its cafeteria, self service, à la carte restaurant and gastronomy for events, Abades Loja offers a gastronomic proposal that adapts to any type of client. In addition, it has different gift and souvenir shops, a parapharmacy, and a themed shop specializing in products made with extra virgin olive oil. Its facilities have free parking for customers and a special area for tourist buses and large vehicles. Inside we find an area for ablutions and Halal food.

title: (18300) Loja -
description: Really nice big parking Slot in the nature in top of the hill. Quite and with an amazing Waking up view! Good spot for Paragliding too

title: (18313) Riofrío - 10 Plaza San Isidro
description: Good site. on the banks of the river.  on the village square, there is a good lighting and many restaurants.  very quiet. village famous for its caviar

title: (18313) Riofrío - 6 Fuente la Trucha
description:
Great place to stay by the sound of a river flowing next to a large ruin, at night very chilled out, just some soft sounds of ducks, geese and cats which are lovely to visit and meet. also a great walkway shed nature over the ancient ruins with the nice cold river passing by. Of course, there are no signs that you cannot spend the night here, so it is worth visiting for one night.

About 20 meters to the right where there are some stairs to the river, water falls from a pipe where the locals go to collect it in jugs, ideal for drinking or refilling jugs.

title: (18313) Riofrío - 41 Plaza San Isidro
description: Where there is a source of drinking water

title: (18313) Loja - 1 Cortijo Santa Ana
description: With the motorway exit 200 meters away A92 towards Granada. Also A92 Malaga at 500 meters. It has a small supermarket and a bakery in front of the field. Very quiet place, village of 300 inhabitants.

title: (18313) Loja - 2 Cortijo Santa Ana
description: They sell butane and propane cylinders, Cepsa and Repsol

title: (18300) Venta del Rayo - Unnamed Road
description:
Parking next to the Sierra Gorda Viewpoint, in the middle of a wind farm with incredible views and sunsets. Access by forest tracks with some steep slopes. To access it, you have to do it from the Los Abades service station. If you put the GPS on, you have to take the detour to the left in the Majada del Charco Negro and then take the path that comes out to the right.
Access is not allowed from June to September.

title: (18313) Loja - 301 Calle Sevilla
description:
Great spot. Very quiet.
Hard gravel slightly sloping.
East facing.

title: (18300) Loja - 303 Calle Sevilla
description: Parking day and night.

title: (18300) Loja - 2 Cuesta Ayozares
description: Drinking water

title: (18270) Montefrío - 3 Huerta Hospital
description: Good parking to visit the town

title: (18300) Loja - 28 Cuesta Ayozares
description: Place where there is a source with drinking water

title: (18270) Montefrío - 9 Calle Manuel de Falla
description: Parking without problem for the night and without traffic. Next to the door of a supermarket. With views of the villa and castle of Montefrio.

title: (18270) Montefrío - 12 Avenida Antonio Luis Soler
description: According to National Geographic this village is in the top 10 in the world in terms of views, beautiful village. Where I am about three places for motorhome, but there is another area in the city Funeral for 10 motorhomes.

title: (18328) Pinos Puente - Unnamed Road
description:
Parking for cemetery. 
Slightly sloping.
Peaceful.
We only stopped for lunch but I think staying  overnight would be possible.

title: (18327) Láchar - 220 A-92
description: Service area with gas station and cafeteria. Non-potable water hose at the rear. I have bought some things and I have loaded water, the employees are very friendly.

title: () Loja - CP-74
description: Several spots at side of very quiet rural gravel road on a firm mostly level grassy verge with beautiful views of valley below. Not a single car passed us by on a Friday night. We think there are only 3 or 4 houses further down the road so very quiet indeed.

title: (18312) Iznájar - 31 Calle Granada de Ventorros de Balerma
title_short: (18312) Iznájar - 31 Calle Granada de Ventorros de Balerma
description: Area with a beautiful view of the Iznajar dam, in a very quiet village. With fountains for water filling and next to the playground. On Sundays there is a street market so it is best to park near the school.

address.street: 31 Calle Granada de Ventorros de Balerma

title: (18327) Láchar - 80 Calle Íllora
description: Drinkable water fountain - easy access for all sizes of campers

title: (18120) Alhama de Granada - 3 Calle Pablo Picasso
title_short: (18120) Alhama de Granada - 3 Calle Pablo Picasso
description: Eco-Natural Autoservice laundry. Two washers 15 and 20kg, one dryer.

title: (18120) Alhama de Granada - A-402
description: Area in Alhama de Granada with beautiful views. Friday morning there is a Market, you can be parked but you can't go in or out. All services are as you enter the parking lot on the left. Drain gray (grid in front of the containers), black (round box to the right of the containers) and water tap hidden in a square box to the left of the containers, threaded. Maximum 7 days. The enclosure cannot be used on fair days in June and September. There is water, but it is hidden in a box on the ground, near the drain grate.

title: (18120) Alhama de Granada - 1 Calle Carniceria
description: Drinking spring water intake, source where you can park the A/C without interrupting the lane to be able to fill water without problems. very close to the A/C parking area where there is no drinking water intake.

title: (18120) Alhama de Granada - 59 Carretera Ventas Zafarraya
title_short: (18120) Alhama de Granada - 59 Carretera Ventas Zafarraya
description: Near the fire department, it is a street, but very quiet

title: (18314) Cuesta La Palma - 21 Calle San Rafael de Venta del Rayo
title_short: (18314) Cuesta La Palma - 21 Calle San Rafael de Venta del Rayo
description: Gas station with bar/restaurant also has a big self service washing station suitable for every size of camper including trucks.

address.street: 21 Calle San Rafael de Venta del Rayo

title: (18120) Alhama de Granada - 48 Barrio San Diego
title_short: (18120) Alhama de Granada - 48 Barrio San Diego
description: Water tap on sharp bend. Lay by to stop in and run hose to.

title: (18339) Cijuela - 39 Calle Asturias
description: Secure parking near gas station cafeteria 24 hours open hotel near Granada.

title: (14970) Iznájar - Unnamed Road
description: If you have a large motorhome it is practically impossible to go beyond this point and reach the shores of the lake. The road slopes dangerously sideways (except for cars). to get here there is a small descent, a bit narrow but doable. in two minutes you can easily reach the lake on foot. super quiet area and with good 4g reception. take the rubbish away because there are no bins.

title: (18128) Zafarraya - Camino de las Parideras
description:
BEAUTIFUL place especially for hikers and climbers (Via Ferrata John Hogbin) with excellent scenery.

ENTERING THE AREA IS DIFFICULT 
As the entrance is uneven and steep. 

The bar is open several days a week and the people are super friendly. 

The toilets are open as long as the bar is open. 

Showers can be free when getting a drink at the bar. 

Electricity sockets are in the bathrooms. 

There is a spring with drinking water.

title: (14970) Iznájar - Unnamed Road
description: Magnificent site in the middle of nature on the edge of the artificial lake. Attention only accessible small vans. Dirt track accessible from the road heading east before the Casa del Olivar. The road from Merendero Iznajar (place located on the cliffs) has collapsed.

title: (18339) Chauchina - 20 Calle Acera Sol
description: Drinking water source

title: (18291) Zujaira - 26 Calle Pilar
description: Channeled natural source. very crowded by the townspeople to fill gua Good ample parking area

title: (14970) Iznájar - Paseo Donantes de Sangre
description: Very nice place at the edge of a path that runs along the lake. The location is quite flat and offers a wonderful view of the lake and the white village of Iznajar. Very calm with some joggers in the morning

title: (18329) Chimeneas - GR-3402
description: New big place. no sign that forbids staying overnight.

title: (29315) Archidona - 56 Urbanizacion Ue. S3
description: Parking for cars, trucks and trailers. Also motorhomes.

title: (18120) Alhama de Granada - A-4150
description: Parking departure from hiking trail that leads to Alhama de Granada 2 km. Quiet no service

title: (14970) Iznájar - 2 Paseo Donantes de Sangre
description: Parking area where you can spend the night. Very close to the reservoir and with a large sunny square next to it, as well as a park with swings and picnic tables just below.

title: (18120) Alhama de Granada -
description: Beautiful place on the edge of a lake. Nice view and flat. Not much shade so might not be useful in summer

title: (29315) Archidona - 2 Urbanizacion los Eucaliptos SUR.S.2
description: Place with picnic tables, fountain, shadows, children's park, courts to play soccer and basketball, perfect for a stop, near the road junction towards Malaga if you come from Granada, all very clean and so we must leave it after use. good route

title: (18120) Alhama de Granada - A-4150
description: Parking in front of the Hotel El Ventorro. With a view of the marsh. There are trees that give shade to sleep as long as you want, but it might get busy at weekends as the restaurant over the road is awesome! It's near the highway but few cars pass there at night. The only noise during the night is actually the singing of the ducks.

title: (14970) Iznájar - 1 Plaza de la Venta
description: Small parking lot to visit the village, overnight possible, easily accessible, can be full of cars, but easy ½ ride.

title: (18120) Alhama de Granada - A-4150
description: Recreation area. Shadow, barbecue and water. Not particularly pretty but good for a day and a night. WARNING: We have been warned by a local that people use this place at night for "strange activities" and a conflicted man comes here running at night. We have decided not to stay but that is up to you. Still a nice place to spend the day however There is water with the possibility of connecting the pipes to the toilet with very good flow

title: (18131) Ventas de Huelma - 50T Calle Escuelas
description: Quiet area next to a park with a water fountain, playground for children, gym equipment, ping-pong table... Right next to it there is a path where you can see the old cave houses, currently uninhabited. Very quiet town with basic services: supermarket, bakery, tobacconist, gas station, bank, ATM... Several bars where you can eat well. We recommend the Bernardo Restaurant, with good treatment and good cuisine. On weekends, especially in summer, it can be noisy, as it is a meeting place for local youth. During the week very quiet.

title: (18330) Chauchina - A-92
description: Stamped next to BP service station behind a busy restaurant. good place to park during the day, at night being next to the highway it is noisy, at night I moved further inside the polygon...interesting for a stop along the way.

title: (18120) Alhama de Granada - A-402
description: Very nice view towards the sunset, a little set back from the road, in a left turn coming from the north (2 trees). A few passages of large fruit and vegetable trucks... The last at 9 p.m., the first at 9 a.m. Quiet otherwise.

title: (14970) Iznájar - 20 Calle las Tres Cruces
description: Perfect, a bit crooked

title: (14970) Iznájar - 208 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Viewpoint with benches, bins and drinking water point...no long term parking. Water only runs at 3 liters per minute, 1/2 inch thread.

title: (14970) Iznájar - A-333
description: Easy parking for larger vehicles. Hard and level surface

title: (14978) Iznájar - A-333
description: Small parking for 3 motor homes of 6m or Campers. Right at the end of the bridge over the swamp of Iznájar. Noisy on the road but an option to hang out

title: (14970) Iznájar - 1 Calle el Remolino
description: Multisport center parking area, flat, gravel, garbage cans but no service. Free. Lake nearby.

title: (18126) Arenas del Rey - A-338
description: It's the first parking arriving in the natural park, it's levelled and there's shade! It's gives you access to the beginning of the lake and it's super quiet

title: (14979) Iznájar - 21 Calle los Arrayanes
description: Water fountain near play area, just passed the Sports facilities. There is also another water source with a screw fitting coming out of the ground further down from the fountain.

name: Narnia lodgings
title: (18128) Narnia lodgings
description:
Narnia Lodgings
Small beautiful campsite or pitch for caravans / tents and mobile homes, the owners speak German, English and Spanish. You are warmly welcomed here and have a nice, quiet spot in the middle of the Andalusian mountains. Pets and dogs are also welcome. Showers, toilets and washing machines are available.

title: (14970) Iznájar - 14 Calle los Arrayanes
description: Area in front of a playground where you can park (two motorhomes fit loose). we have spent a very quiet night in absolute silence. It is also great to enjoy as a family, both for the playground, as for the small forest behind. And, of course, the Valdearenas beach 100 meters away.

title: (14970) Iznájar - 3 Calle los Farfanes
description: Unpaved place on the outskirts of the village. Great view, quiet nights. Camping ban signs . Drinking water at several taps in the direction of the reservoir exhibition.

title: (14979) Iznájar - 5 Calle las Angosturas
description: Parking Next to the Iznajar Pantano Beach. In El Chiringuito de Valdearenas de Gracia and Paco. Super quiet place at night. By day it fills up. We enter with an AC of 7.10 meters without problem as long as you put your ass towards the swamp.

name: Camping Valdearenas in Iznajar SL.
title: (14979) Camping Valdearenas in Iznajar SL.
description: Camping Valdearenas! Family camping in the countryside. Nautical activities on the lake. Beach valdearenas

title: (18129) Pantano de los Bermejales - 40 Diseminado Pantano
title_short: (18129) Pantano de los Bermejales - 40 Diseminado Pantano
description: Drinking water tap Here you can fill up your tank.

title: (18129) Pantano de los Bermejales - 3 Calle Hortensia
title_short: (18129) Pantano de los Bermejales - 3 Calle Hortensia
description: Well leveled ground parking. Next to the entrance to the road that crowns the Swamp. In the day quite crowded by visitors to the area. The quiet night.

title: (14817) Priego de Córdoba - 86 Avenida Priego
description: It is a flat area next to the road where you can park. From this point the route begins towards La Tiñosa, the highest peak in the province of Córdoba. It is located in the village of Las Lagunillas and there is a bar, bakery, supermarket, tobacconist, etc. nearby. Being about 20 meters from the road, vehicles can be heard but there is little traffic, since it is a secondary road that goes from Priego to Rute passing through villages. They fit 3 AC of 7.5m, the maneuver is easy and it is quite flat, in general very quiet. The townspeople / hamlet come by and say hello kindly.

title: (18128) Zafarraya - 1 Calle Cementerio
description: Parking spot next to cemetery. nothing fancy but does the trick. close to village centre and some grocery shops

title: (14978) Iznájar - Unnamed Road
description: Fountain with drinking water

title: (18129) Pantano de los Bermejales - 48G Calle Mulhacen
title_short: (18129) Pantano de los Bermejales - 48G Calle Mulhacen
description: We only found this place in the morning but think it might be fine to stay over night too. if not, there is more space along the lake about 100 mtr further along. beautiful view over the lake. Noisy on Saturday mornings though, due to hunting, but I guess that's the case anywhere in rural spain.

title: (14970) Iznájar - Unnamed Road
description: This is not a car park just an overnight parking spot in a dead end.

title: (18126) Arenas del Rey - GR-4302
description:
The place is just magnificent. 
Very easy access (our van is 6m long). 
A spot not to be missed if you are in the area. No refueling or emptying point so it is better to plan because once you land here, you want to stay there.
There are a few Picknick tables.

title: () Pantano de los Bermejales -
description: Spot around the lake to be preferred! It is the opposite of the campsite and stray dogs, it is cool under the pines, quiet. Ideal ! We spent a fantastic night in the middle of summer. Rare, friendly walkers. Do not make fire, do not leave waste. The path is passable only in dry weather, bumpy path. We have a T5.

title: (18126) Arenas del Rey - GR-4302
description: Nearby but quiet road along the embalse de los bermajales. Take the path to the lake that leads to a half circle of trees, pass between 2 trees, land just after. Forbidden to stay overnight. Camping forbidden!

title: (18120) -
description: Free parking day and night for motorhomes. Restaurant next door.

name: Camping Granada - Los Bermejales
title: (18126) Camping Granada - Los Bermejales
description: Spectacular place cozy friendly family... In a very poor environment. Ideal place for walks and routes by bicycle and for walking or hiking in all around the reservoir and very well priced. I will return as soon as I have another free weekend

title: (18132) Agrón - 3 Camino Riachillo
description: Beautiful place on the outskirts of the village, quiet, with trees and water

title: (18129) Pantano de los Bermejales -
description: Direct place on the shore in front of the campsite, turn on the small deposit to the lake and drive on the dried-up lake bottom to any place on the shore. Lots of space to spread. beautiful mountain landscape with clear water

title: (18248) Tiena - GR-3408
description: Small picnic area with 3 tables. we spent a quiet night there, without car noise in the evening despite the nearby road. there is space for a motorhome. Magnificent view with the sunset.

title: (18130) Escúzar - Unnamed Road
description: Placette on the side of a wide path without passage, beautiful 360 degree views of the countryside and Granada in the distance. Calles one more.

title: (18125) Valdeiglesias -
description: Recreational area of Robledal, access to the path leading to the maroma. We spent the night quiet, alone with animals outside the van. Freshwater taps, grills and barbecues. Access not closed and without explicit prohibitions on the billboard, except to make a fire.

title: (18240) Pinos Puente - 13 Camino Cementerio
description: According to one comment, it would be a dangerous place… Parking next to the school and the cemetery. The road is hardly used at night. It is advisable to park on the right, as school buses and cars are parked on the left in the morning. We slept well.

title: (29313) Villanueva del Trabuco - 24 Diseminado Poligono 13
description: Recreation area. Next to the source of the 100 pipes, very pleasant.

title: (18125) Ventas de Zafarraya - 53 Calle Delicias
description: Picnic area with great views, approx. 10 - 15 parking spaces for cars

title: (23689) - Camino Olivares
description: Almazara au milieu de la nature, des activités touristiques et de l'expérience organoleptique. Vous pouvez obtenir de l'huile d'olive extra vierge de Jaén. Un charmant village où vous pourrez profiter des couchers de soleil de la subbética Cordoue et de la sierra méridionale de Jaén. La tranquillité est l'atmosphère qui règne ici. Des itinéraires sont disponibles à proximité pour faire du vélo et de la marche. Idéal pour aller avec des enfants.

title: (29313) Villanueva del Trabuco - A-7203
description: Gas station with showers

title: (14812) Almedinilla - 1E Paseo Moreras
description: Site to leave without problems and spend the night. It is next to a park in general you have everything and it is a town with a lot of history it is recommended to go to the tourist office and ask for information

title: (29313) illanueva del Trabuco - Crta de Granada, Km 7
title_short: (29313) illanueva del Trabuco - Crta de Granada, Km 7
description: Showering is possible here. Ask at the bar in the restaurant of the Repsol petrol station - then up the stairs on the right and the first door on the left. A whole room with shower, toilet and hairdryer. water is hot! staff very nice!

title: (18320) Santa Fe - 609 Ue-23
description: Parking spaces along the industrial zone road.  Free at night.  Repair boxes man nearby.  Good for one night!

title: (18320) Santa Fe - 6135 Calle Avenida de América
title_short: (18320) Santa Fe - 6135 Calle Avenida de América
description: Parking in a wooded area. The noise of the road is heard. Organic, glass, paper and plastic bins and containers. Figures of wild animals. Sport Center. City center 300 m.

title: (14812) Almedinilla - Calle Media Era, 1
description: Quiet and quite flat street, next to a gym park and soccer field. Near the municipal pool, ideal in summer. Without services. Perfect to visit Almedinilla and close to shops and bars that serve you free tapas. Almedinilla is beautiful, with fountains, flower patios and pretty trails. Its Iberian settlement, the Roman villa and the waterfall of the horse jumping to Fuente Grande is a must visit. We have spent three days here and great. It is a quiet and safe town.

title: (14812) Almedinilla - 33 Paseo Alameda
description: Information Point Parking to see the incredible ruins of El Ruedo, a Roman villa from the 1st century AD.

title: (18320) Santa Fe - Urbanización Pp-2
description: Parking to spend the night quietly, has trees which can provide shade. On Thursdays there is a market. Town with great history where the Capitulations for the trip of Colon to America were signed. It is worth visiting the center at 1km. There is a bakery at 200m where you can buy bread and the best are the palms ... delicious.

title: (18126) Arenas del Rey -
description: After a few hundred meters on track, passage of an edge of pine forest, flat place. Quiet, birdsong, 100m from the turquoise blue dam. I went with a 6m50 motorhome without a problem.

title: (18126) Arenas del Rey - Unnamed Road
description: Excellent place to visit the lake. The entrance is on a dirt road just before the city. Forbidden at night: nature reserve

title: (18247) Moclín - 5 Carretera de Tiena
description: Parking by the side of a quiet road on the edge of the village. Stunning view across the plain towards the rising sun. From here you can visit the castle and also make the route of the PR A-84, called Ruta del Gollizno (derived from "gollizo": narrowness of a place).

title: (18247) Moclín - 71 Calle Real
description: Place to park and spend the night, without services, uneven but spacious and quiet, crowded on weekends as a parking lot for hikers.

title: (18247) Moclín - 8 Calle Hacho
description: Parking area in Moclín next to a public park, hermitage and the Post Office. There is no traffic as it is a dead end street. Allows maneuvering without difficulty.

title: (29313) Villanueva del Trabuco - 29A Diseminado Poligono 11
description: If you let your camper ventilate at night by opening a window, several dogs will keep you awake at night. In the early morning cars, trucks and tractors drive past this place.

title: (29194) Alfarnate - 2 Calle Jardines
description: In the village, playground a few meters away, near the market and the municipal swimming pool .... beginning of two hiking trails ... very quiet. damaged terrain slope to access it with a hole and gravel

title: (18247) Moclín - 16 Calle Hacho
description: Quiet parking, next to sports courts, beautiful views, level, without services

title: (29194) Alfarnate - 1 Calle Jardines
description: Small plain area in the corner of a public park/picnic area. you can park your motorhome . Estimated around 8-10 spaces, depending on your vehicle size. water is accessible. Electricity seems to be available, but where locked in winter (feb.). public toilets and nearby swimmingpool - also closed in winter.

title: (18247) Moclín - 8A Calle Mota
description: Passage in the narrow village

title: (29710) Periana - 54 Jr Jardines
description: Small "era", ideal for camper vans or even motorhomes

title: () Alfarnate - Unnamed Road
description: Picnic area surrounded by trees and with an arboreal adventure park managed by the "Los Pindongos" group. It is an esplanade with (closed) facilities that correspond to an old camping project. Magnificent area to spend a few days of hiking and adventure! Fairly quiet.

title: (29194) Alfarnate - 41 Calle Río
description: Close to the village of Alfarnate on a not too noisy road, calm and quiet night but no service.

title: (18120) Alhama de Granada -
description: Large / beautiful trail parking lot with barbecue, seating and water points. Cold showers and toilets (probably open in the season). Starting point for hikes. Directions via gravel road. Not suitable for large campers.

title: (18248) Olivares - Unnamed Road
description: Recreational area a bit abandoned. Access is via a road in very poor condition and with a steep slope. It has tables and a water fountain. For Campers that are not very low (not for motorhomes). We stayed one night and did the Gollizno route and visited Moclin.

title: (18248) Olivares - Unnamed Road
description: It costs to get there but very well, nearby picnic areas, without services.

title: (18320) Santa Fe - nº1 Plaza José Martí
title_short: (18320) Santa Fe - nº1 Plaza José Martí
description: Public parking in the center of the village. Ideal to comfortably visit the town. Quiet and safe.

title: (29710) Periana - 52 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Very quiet place, there is room for two vans

title: (18126) Arenas del Rey - 32 GR-3302
description: Drinking water with good drainage

title: (18248) Moclín - 8 Calle Cerro Alto
description: Perfect parking area to start the Gollizno route. It is not the official start, but being circular, it does not matter. Only three km from the bridges. The last climb is somewhat narrow, but the open field has room to maneuver. Nearby there is a good children's park (uphill street).

title: (29300) Archidona - 5 Calle Lavanderos
description: Very quiet place to sleep

title: (18127) Arenas del Rey - Unnamed Road
description: On a dirt road about 80m from the lake, right next to an olive tree plantation. Unpaved driveway, only suitable for smaller vehicles. Very quiet.

title: (29711) Alcaucín - Camino de los Colmenares
description: Mirador de Pedro Aguilar, a little above the "El Alcazar" leisure area. In the recreation area you will find barbecues, toilets, showers.

title: (29300) Archidona - 133 Camino Fuente Sacristán
description: Very quiet place to sleep

title: (29313) Villanueva del Trabuco - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet place and lot of space. Nice wiew. Water is nearby

title: (29710) Periana - 22 MA-156
description: Small parking in Baños de Vilo. Next to the river and 100 meters from the sulfurous baths.

title: (29300) Archidona - 15 Urbanización Llano de San Juan
title_short: (29300) Archidona - 15 Urbanización Llano de San Juan
description: Very quiet place to sleep

title: (18130) La Malahá - A-385
description: Small and clean spot next to Baños termales La Malaha. No services.

title: (23680) Alcalá la Real - 544 Carretera de Córdoba
title_short: (23680) Alcalá la Real - 544 Carretera de Córdoba
description: Large parking in pebbles attached to the gas station, slept a night in tranquility apart from two cocks that sang.

title: (29300) Archidona - 237 Urbanización Chico Alberiz
description: Parking, quiet and close to Mercadona to get to know Archidona

title: (29711) Alcaucín - Unnamed Road
description: The Alcázar playgrounds. Camping forbidden.

title: (14800) Priego de Córdoba - 0 Calle Huerto Almarcha
title_short: (14800) Priego de Córdoba - 0 Calle Huerto Almarcha
description: Speed Queen automatic laundry. Very good laundry with recent equipment and very efficient. Cheap service. Only downside, difficult to park nearby.

title: (14800) Priego de Córdoba - 22 Calle Ramón y Cajal
title_short: (14800) Priego de Córdoba - 22 Calle Ramón y Cajal
description: 24-hour guarded parking very central, ideal for visiting Priego.

title: (14800) Priego de Córdoba - 15 Calle San Luis
title_short: (14800) Priego de Córdoba - 15 Calle San Luis
description: Parking in the city center, quite quiet, possibility of spending the night. No service, but no access problem in any case for vehicles of 7 m. A bit messy but free! Possibility of parking several motorhomes but I do not know the usual occupation during the week, but today the park is almost empty. Have a nice stay in Andalusia!

title: (29210) Cuevas de San Marcos - CO-9003
description: Spring with good drinking water on the street side

title: (14800) Priego de Córdoba - 27 Calle Libertad
description: Parking in the village, next to the health center

title: (29311) - 5 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Casa Valle de Oro welcomes people traveling in their motorhome or motorhome (max 7 meters). No caravans. Maximum 2 people. Maximum 2 dogs, no cats. We have only 1 parking place between old olive trees, next to a gorge where a small river flows. Enjoy a wonderful holiday sheltered by beautiful olive trees, lounging by the pool or in the zen pool. Relax with a book from our library. Put on your hiking boots and explore the countryside. Take pictures of the beautiful surroundings. Or do nothing - nothing at all. Casa Valle de Oro is an idyllic spot in an unspoilt environment, perfect for stargazing. On our roof terrace you can enjoy beautiful views and spectacular sunsets. This is pampered camping and you are guaranteed to leave with charged batteries :-) . You can only use a private bathroom in the winter season. In the summer season this is only possible when a yurt bathroom is available. If not, there is an outdoor shower by the pool (cold water). There is a toilet room with sink (hot water). Electricity and water are free. Please check 1 day in advance for availability as we only have one motorhome pitch. Check in from 2pm - check out 11am

title: (23680) Alcalá la Real - S/N A-335
description: Shell gas station, with beautiful views of the Fortaleza de la Mota, with a cafeteria-restaurant, a small supermarket, free parking for cars and trucks, all open 24 hours.

title: (29194) Alfarnatejo - 2 Calle la Cuesta
description: Very close to the town, very quiet place next to the river with grass floor and trees

title: (29210) Cuevas de San Marcos -
description: Quiet area next to the Iznajar reservoir and next to the trail for hiking or biking. It has no water intake or possibility of emptying.

title: (18249) Tózar - 2 Calle Nueva ag Tozar
description:
Level place/parking in rural village. Quiet to spent a night. Bakery comes in a van in the (late) morning (beeps).
Access very easy with any camper size. Other options also available around the village.
Free water tap with connector available on site, behind the building.

title: (23680) Alcalá la Real - 4 Camino Coto
description: Very wide unpaved road at the back of the institute. Super quiet, secluded and plenty of room to park.

title: (14960) Rute - 74 Poblado del Pantano
description: Camping type area at the foot of the swamp. A quiet place, although it could be better preserved.

title: (29710) Periana - Finca Oasis Las Palmeras
description: Beautiful site with mountain, lake and sea views. 2 minutes away from the  typical Andalucian village of Periana (shops, doctors, banks etc). Water, electricity, waste disposal. Restaurant on site. Secure. Locked at night. Lots of walking routes, bird watching, mountain biking. Half hour from coast. Booking essential. Access via Periana village recommended.

title: (14960) Rute - 90 Poblado del Pantano
description: Great view...nothing going on during the week...1.4km running route, swimming in the lake and 5km bike ride to the supermarket...

title: (14960) Rute - 90 Poblado del Pantano
description: Nice flat parking for about 5 vans. Surrounded by trees. Easy accessible. Nice view over the lake. Lake 200m down the road. Unfortunately a lot of trash around, but I will clean. So please take your trash! :)

title: (23680) Alcalá la Real - 2 Calle Guitarrista Pepe Ramos
title_short: (23680) Alcalá la Real - 2 Calle Guitarrista Pepe Ramos
description:
Welcome to:
Area for motorhomes, campers...
Nestled in the Sierra Sur de Jaén. Bordering Granada, Jaén and Córdoba, a perfect place to disconnect and get to know Alcalá la Real.

title: (14960) Rute - 205 Calle Francisco Salto
description: Large parking lot for Motorhomes. Buses and cars usually park, very close to the Rute Center and Museums of Anis, Jamón... also panoramic view. From there you can exit to go to the Tower

title: (23680) Alcalá la Real - 5 Calle Vereda del Carmen
title_short: (23680) Alcalá la Real - 5 Calle Vereda del Carmen
description: Hello partners. I park here. It is a quiet area to sleep. You only hear the garbage truck and then after 7 a car that goes to work. I spent the night from Sunday to Monday. I don't know if being next to a park on Friday and Saturday nights there will be an issue with the young people. Greetings and see you on the road.

title: (14800) Priego de Córdoba - 66 Avenida D Niceto Alcalá Zamora y Torres
title_short: (14800) Priego de Córdoba - 66 Avenida D Niceto Alcalá Zamora y Torres
description:
Free space with services. Gray water, WC, water and cans. It is a quiet place.

The entrance passes through a park, it is at the fairgrounds.

About 20 minutes walk from the city center.

Access prohibited on Saturdays from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m.

address.street: 66 Avenida D Niceto Alcalá Zamora y Torres

title: (29210) Cuevas de San Marcos - MA-202
description: Mirador Viewpoint. Parked overnight flat. One other van joined us. Normally a viewpoint but trees restrict any view.

title: (29710) Periana - 12 Calle Aijaznatejo
description: Typical town of the Axarquia Malagueña that maintains all its essence and peculiarity. The Parking is gravel. The van can be parked without problems. If you prefer, 20 meters away you can park on asphalt in some urbanized plots that have not been built. Garbage bins are nearby but they are on the next street.

title: (14960) Rute - 77 Poblado del Pantano
description: Old bus parking area for the hermitage, very quiet and surrounded by nature. Very discreet.

name: Área autocaravanas Priego de Córdoba
title: (14800) Área autocaravanas Priego de Córdoba
description:
Area in Priego de Córdoba. 
Municipal free pitch with supply and disposal. The pitch is mostly very sloping. Quiet location next to a beautiful park. Shops and restaurants are located in the city center of 2 km. The area. There is no access in or out on Saturdays between 7am and 3pm due to market.

title: (14960) Rute - 45 Calle Paseo del Fresno
description: Close to the Anis Museum, whose owner said we could park for the night there after tasting the product! It is clearly used for events and there are toilets there. The town aire (N37.331450 W4.373337) is also good but beware - water is no longer available, only emptying although it is still signed as Motorhome Services.

title: () Rute - Unnamed Road
description: Fuente Alta Recreational Area. It is an area with tables and seats to spend the day outdoors. It has a source of untreated water. You can do some hiking route. There is very little space to park. It is next to some tennis courts. The access is quite narrow but we have accessed with a 7.5 meter motorhome

title: (29710) Periana - 24 Calle Alferez Manuel Jimenez
description: Drinking water push button

name: Camping La Isla
title: (14960) Camping La Isla
description: 3rd category campsite. a lot of unevenness in most of the squares. access to electricity in the square, water must be fetched from a source to fill the CV and auto CV. The sewage must be taken to be emptied in a toilet behind the bar. Greywater to the ground directly. there are no barbecues. many dogs of the owners and of the campers loose, without a muzzle. electricity is shared and breaks frequently. PRICE in April 2023 we paid for 2 days 2 adults and 2 children in a caravan 76 euros.

title: (29300) Archidona -
description: The Saucedilla! Rural Tourism House. Car parking, motorhomes, caravans and camper vans.

title: (29300) Archidona - 17 Calle Blas Infante
description: Free municipal area for 10 motorhomes. The water tap does not work, you have to go to the local police. Although it is next to the road it is a quiet place. Ideal for visiting the ochavada square.

title: (14816) La Concepción -
description: Quiet place, in flat

title: (29300) Archidona - s/n Calle Blas Infante
description: Next to the police station

title: (23680) Alcalá la Real - 9 Calle San Salvador
title_short: (23680) Alcalá la Real - 9 Calle San Salvador
description: Laundry

title: (23680) Alcalá la Real - 11 Calle San Francisco
title_short: (23680) Alcalá la Real - 11 Calle San Francisco
description: Great parking, enter the gas station

title: (29210) Cuevas de San Marcos - Unnamed Road
title_short: (29210) Cuevas de San Marcos - Unnamed Road
description: Parking and starting point for the circular walk to the caves. I recommend starting the hike east, clockwise.

title: (23680) Alcalá la Real - 17 Calle Moreas de Gamboa
title_short: (23680) Alcalá la Real - 17 Calle Moreas de Gamboa
description: Place in the middle of nature in Alcala la Real, the climb is not easy for large motorhomes, I spent the night on the route, there are several routes and a climbing area and a children's park. I had no problems.

title: (18195) Cúllar Vega - 150 Camino de las Galeras
title_short: (18195) Cúllar Vega - 150 Camino de las Galeras
description: Good place to visit the fertile plain of Granada. The lung of Granada! there are many flat paths to walk between the fields of tobacco or corn, pastry / bakery at 1 km open from Monday to Sunday on the street of La Vega 144. The bakery La Espiga. fresh bread. very recommendable shaded place, cafe at 200m

title: (14811) Los Villares - 34 Diseminado los Villares
description: Camping- Cortijo Los Villares. Posada Niña Margarita. Motorhome and Camper area. Spectacular enclave for recreation and activities in the mountains. The owner offers accommodation at the Posada if you do not have a Camper or similar. There is also a bar service and meals. We only have 12 plots that give you an authentic family atmosphere and with a 100% guarantee of disconnection and relaxation. The 12 plots with access to electricity and 6 plots without electricity. In La Posada, which is 100 meters away, is the reception. There is a bar and very good internet connection. In spring and summer the Garden works and it is possible to buy totally organic vegetables or share a good time with the "Innkeeper"

name: Cortijo El Bosque
title: (18127) Cortijo El Bosque
description: Nice place in the mountains of the resinera natural park. Close to Jatar and Arenas del Rey and 15 minutes from Alhama de Granada. Very quiet and little noise. If you go on a bicycle route, here is your stop and you can spend the night. Call before to see availability and specify with the owner.

title: (18230) Atarfe - 8B Diseminado Diseminados
description: Beautiful site to see the sunset from 860 m high. Picnic area without services parking is allowed, there is no prohibition of overnight stays. steep climb

title: (18620) Alhendín - 17 Avenida de Grecia
description: Empty industrial area in the middle of nowhere .. Total peace and solitude with great views of the Sierra Nevada .. The area is 3x3 kilometers in size.

title: (29210) Cuevas de San Marcos -
description: On the road to the park in nature P4N spot. It’s a bit down hill but is easily accessible for all types of vehicles. It’s in a very green shady area, which must be nice in summers. It’s nice to hike up the road to the other P4N place and Cueva Nueva. From there it’s easy to climb further if you wish to do so.

title: (29210) Cuevas de San Marcos -
description: Quiet place surrounded by nature, perfect for visiting Cueva Belda, the viewpoint of Cueva Nueva and very close to one of the via ferratas in the mountains. The access road is a bit steep but it is not difficult to get there.

title: (18230) Atarfe - 23 Calle Alfonso Bailón Verdejo
description: municipal car park

title: (29711) Alcaucín - 8 Plaza Salia
description: Good place right next to the town square flea market on Saturday mornings lots of drinking fountains before you get to the car park

title: (14960) Rute - 19 Calle de los Olivos
description: Motorhomes next to the municipal sports zone center. Parking is good and quiet. Download services, but the water is now working.

title: (18230) Atarfe -
description: Ground parking near the hermitage. Further from the viewpoint and therefore with less traffic. Next to the hermitage there is a climbing area, children's area and public toilets.

title: (29312) Villanueva del Rosario - Unnamed Road
description: Parking area for cars, intended for hiking trails. Close to the town of Villanueva del Rosario

title: (18230) Atarfe -
description: Great spot with place for 3 RVs. Amazing view and some benches and bins. Road leading to the site is a bit rough, but doable for a camper.

title: (14960) Rute - 1 Calle Antonio Llamas Cruz
description: New area that replaces the previous one next to the 6-seater municipal soccer field, signs of expansion and better luck

title: (18126) Arenas del Rey - Unnamed Road
description: Nature, place along a stream, see Natural Park Information Center. Very nice hike to the reservoir.
